name: fs_mkdir
description: Create a new directory at the specified path.

path.description: The path of the directory to create

name: fs_patch
description:
Apply a patch to a file at the specified path.
This can be used to edit the file, without having to rewrite the whole file.

path.description: The path of the file to apply to

contents.description:
The patch to apply to the file

Here is an example of a patch block that can be applied to modify the file to request the user's name:
--- a/hello.py
+++ b/hello.py
@@ ... @@
 def hello():
-    print("Hello World")
+    name = input("What is your name? ")
+    print(f"Hello {name}")

name: test_greeter
description:
A comprehensive greeting tool demonstrating argc capabilities

This tool showcases best practices for argc-based bash tools including:
- Required and optional parameters
- Default values and enums
- Multi-value arrays
- Flags (boolean)
- Dynamic choice functions
- Environment variable binding
- Proper output handling
- Input validation

times.description: How many times to repeat the greeting

colors.description: Favorite colors (required array with dynamic choices)
